update.description:
* Adds a new `URI()` member function to the `Base` class. This is similar to `GetScopedName()` but we return a `URI`.

* Register the pose and linear velocity of all the models.

* Register the simulation time in the world.

* Simplified registration with a more convenient way of passing callbacks.

~~Note: this PR is built atop pull request #2144, which should be merged first.[ Here](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/introspection_part5%0Dintrospection_part4#diff)'s a better diff.~~
update.title: Plotting backend - part5 (Register properties and better callbacks)

content.raw:
Can we call this `world_pose` instead? To differentiate from `RelativePose`.

And for linear velocity, I have a personal preference for verboseness, so I'd vote to change it to `linear_velocity`, but that's up to you :)
content.html:
Can we call this world_pose instead? To differentiate from RelativePose.

And for linear velocity, I have a personal preference for verboseness, so I'd vote to change it to linear_velocity, but that's up to you :)

pull_request.title: Plotting backend - part5 (Register properties and better callbacks)

content.raw: Seeing the full list of EntityTypes, it looks like an entity could be both a `JOINT` and `BALL_JOINT` for example. But yeah, in this case it doesn't look like types will ever overlap.
content.html: Seeing the full list of EntityTypes, it looks like an entity could be both a JOINT and BALL_JOINT for example. But yeah, in this case it doesn't look like types will ever overlap.

content.raw: Consider constructing a quaternion from w, x, y, z so we compare to the exact values below. Or comparing below to Roll, Pitch Yaw. The idea is to see the same number on both places...

pullrequest.title: Plotting backend - part5 (Register properties and better callbacks)

content.raw: I think the `typeStr` is correct if the types are mutually exclusive and it seems like this is the case in gazebo (i.e. a model cannot be a link or anything else other than a base and entity). I don't think we need to change any thing here but just want to make a note of it.
content.html: I think the typeStr is correct if the types are mutually exclusive and it seems like this is the case in gazebo (i.e. a model cannot be a link or anything else other than a base and entity). I don't think we need to change any thing here but just want to make a note of it.

content.raw: does the argument need to be const ref for primitive types? I read that passing by value has [better](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14013139/is-it-counter-productive-to-pass-primitive-types-by-reference) [performance](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10770410/reasons-to-not-pass-simple-types-by-reference)
content.html: does the argument need to be const ref for primitive types? I read that passing by value has better performance
